member.name: T:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyDictionary`2
member.summary: A read-only dictionary intended to be forward-compatible with later .NET versions.

Type of value associated with the keys in the wrapped dictionary.

member.summary: Gets the dictionary that is wrapped by this object.

member.name: M:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyDictionary`2.TryGetValue(`0,`1@)
member.summary: Retrieves the value that is associated with the specified key.
member.param: The key whose value will be retrieved.
When this method returns, the value associated with the specified key, if the key is found; otherwise, the default value for the type of the value parameter. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

member.name: P:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyDictionary`2.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of items in the dictionary.

member.summary: Copies the elements of the dictionary to an array, starting at the specified array index.
member.param: The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the dictionary. The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the .

member.name: T:WpfCLR.RelayCommand`1
member.summary: Command which is used to relay interacive events.

member.summary: Occurs when command object's state changes in a way that affect whether the command should be able to execute.

member.summary: Occurs when the value of a property has changed.

member.summary: Controls whether the command may be invoked.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.RelayCommand`1.ConcurrencyLevel
member.summary: Gets the number of conncurent invocations of this command.

member.name: T:WpfCLR.ThisObj
member.summary: Context object for scripts invoked while the XAML window is being displayed.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.ThisObj.NamedElements
member.summary: Named elements (control) detected from XAML markup.
member.remarks: When the is invoked, the values will be the corresponding elements in the XAML markup.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.ThisObj.MainWindow
member.summary: Main WPF window being displayed.
member.remarks: This will be null if the window hasn't been created yet, or if there was an error while trying to create the window

member.name: P:WpfCLR.ThisObj.SynchronizedData
member.summary: Data which will be synchronized with the property of the object responsible for creating the WPF window.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.ThisObj.Output
member.summary: Collection which contains the resulting output from displaying the WPF window.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.ThisObj.ErrorRecords
member.summary: Collection which contains the resulting error records generated while displaying the WPF window.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.ThisObj.WarningRecords
member.summary: Collection which contains the resulting warning messages generated while displaying the WPF window.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.ThisObj.VerboseRecords
member.summary: Collection which contains the resulting verbose messages generated while displaying the WPF window.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.ThisObj.DebugRecords
member.summary: Collection which contains the resulting debug messages generated while displaying the WPF window.

member.name: M:WpfCLR.ThisObj.AttachButtonClick(System.Windows.Controls.Button,System.Management.Automation.ScriptBlock)
member.summary: Attach a script block to a button click event.
member.param: The button to attache the click even to.
The script block that will handle the click event.

member.name: T:WpfCLR.GetMainWindowHandler
member.summary: (internal) Handles event which creates the main WPF window.

member.name: T:WpfCLR.WindowProcessInternal
member.summary: Internal class which manages the creation and invocation of the WPF window.

member.name: M:WpfCLR.WindowProcessInternal.CreateMainWindow
member.summary: This gets invoked by an internally-generated script at a point when the main window is to be created.

member.name: M:WpfCLR.WindowProcessInternal.ShowMainWindow(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This gets invoked by an internally-generated script at a point when the main window is to be shown.

member.name: M:WpfCLR.WindowProcessInternal.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes this object and the associated PowerShell instance.

member.name: T:WpfCLR.WpfWindow
member.summary: Proxy object for a WPF window.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.SynchronizedData
member.summary: Data which is provided to the , and parameters.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.DialogResult
member.summary: A value that specifies whether the activity was accepted (true) or canceled (false) after the last time the window was shown.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.WindowXaml
member.summary: Text which contains the XAML markup that is used to create the WPF window.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.Output
member.summary: Collection of values which represent the output from the , and parameters.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.ErrorRecords
member.summary: Collection of objects which represent the errors encountered while showing the window as well as executing the , and parameters.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.WarningRecords
member.summary: Collection of objects which represent the warning messages emitted while showing the window as well as executing the , and parameters.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.VerboseRecords
member.summary: Collection of objects which represent the verbose messages emitted while showing the window as well as executing the , and parameters.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.DebugRecords
member.summary: Collection of objects which represent the debug messages emitted while showing the window as well as executing the , and parameters.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.BeforeWindowCreated
member.summary: Script which gets executed before the XAML window is created.
member.remarks: When this script is invoked, the "$this" variable will be an instance of the object.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.BeforeWindowShown
member.summary: Script which gets executed after the XAML window is created, but before it is shown.
member.remarks: When this script is invoked, the "$this" variable will be an instance of the object. If $this.Window is null, then that means there was an error while trying to create the window.

member.name: P:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.AfterWindowClosed
member.summary: Script which gets executed after the XAML window has been displayed and has been closed.
member.remarks: When this script is invoked, the "$this" variable will be an instance of the object. If $this.Window is null, then that means there was an error while trying to create the window, also indicating that no window was actually displayed.

member.name: M:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.AddOutput(System.Management.Automation.PSDataStreams)
member.summary: Add output from a object to the , , and collections.
member.param: Data streams object to be added.

member.name: M:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.AddOutput(System.Management.Automation.PSDataCollection{System.Management.Automation.PSObject})
member.summary: Add async output to the collections.
member.param: Output object to be added.

member.name: M:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.AddOutput(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Management.Automation.PSObject})
member.summary: Add output to the collections.
member.param: Output object to be added.

member.name: M:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.AddError(System.String,System.String,System.Exception,System.String,System.Management.Automation.ErrorCategory,System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an error record to the collection.
member.param: The replacement error message for the exception. This cannot be null, empty or entirely whitespace.
Recommended action that should be taken as a result of this error.
The exception that is associated with this record. This cannot be null.
A developer-defined identifier of the error. This identifier must be a non-localized string for a specific error type and cannot be null, empty or entirely whitespace.
An constant that defines the category of the error (for display purposes).
Description of the activity that caused the error.
Description of the reason for the error.
The object that was being operated on when the error occurred.

member.name: M:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.AssertValidXaml(System.String,System.Xml.XmlDocument@)
member.summary: Asserts that a string value contains valid XML markup that represents a WPF window.
member.param: The XML to be parsed.
The parsed XML document object.
member.exception: is empty or contains no markup.
The root element of is not a WPF window.

member.name: M:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.TryValidateXaml(System.String,System.Exception@,System.Xml.XmlDocument@)
member.summary: Attempts to validate that a string value contains valid XML markup which represents a WPF window.
member.param: The XML to be parsed.
Exception that was thrown while trying to validate the document.
The parsed XML document object or null if an exception occurred.
member.returns: True if the XML is valid; otherwise false. This invokes to validate the XML.

member.name: M:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.TryValidateXaml(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Attempts to validate that a string value contains valid XML markup which represents a WPF window.
member.param: The XML to be parsed.
Message which represents the result of validation.
member.returns: True if the XML is valid; otherwise false.

member.name: M:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.ShowDialog(System.Management.Automation.Host.PSHost)
member.summary: Displays WPF window as a dialog (modal).
member.param: The PowerShell host to be used.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the activity was accepted (true) or canceled (false). The return value is the value of the DialogResult property before the window closes.

member.name: M:WpfCLR.WpfWindow.Show(System.Management.Automation.Host.PSHost)
member.summary: Displays WPF window, permitting child windows to be created.
member.param: The PowerShell host to be used.
member.returns: A value that specifies whether the activity was accepted (true) or canceled (false). The return value is the value of the DialogResult property before the window closes.
